website_summaries.verdict: Band saw blade made from low-carbide steel to make for a durable cutting tool.
pros: Band saw blade 3/4" x 93-1/2", 3 TPI (teeth per inch)
Durable, high-quality materials – silicon and low-carbide steel – used to make this blade
According to manufacturer, the blade is Ideal for re-sawing thick stock
Blade runs cooler and lasts longer, plus it's effective with low tension, therefore requiring less horsepower to operate.Thin kerf (slit created by cutting)

customer_reviews.title: Probably better for larger bandsaws
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 14" Jet 1HP Bandsaw and while I was impressed with the cutting action and tracking for resawing, I don't think my saw is powerful enough for this blade. I actually acquired this saw with a generic 3/8" blade with 6 tpi and found it actually cut quicker, but wandered horribly. I've since added the riser block for this saw and bought the larger Timber Wolf blade but in 1/2" size with 4tpi and I think it is much more balanced for this saw. In my limited experience, I think larger motor saws should be able to handle this blade without issue... 1HP saws may do better with a narrower blade.
customer_reviews.author: AdobeTX

customer_reviews.title: Eats wood fast, leaves smooth surface.
customer_reviews.text: I had a 14” band saw with fine tooth blades. I wanted to try processing some hardwood from my land into some usable material for projects I had in mind. The blades I had, which were good blades couldn’t handle the job. I was a little skeptical that an inexpensive blade like this would do much good at it either. Man am I tickled at how easily this blade cuts rough slab wood into smooth straight boards! I’m looking at the trees on My place in a whole new light now. I don’t know about the longevity of the blade, but for the price, not sure it matters.
customer_reviews.author: Okeytrapper

customer_reviews.title: better than the price
customer_reviews.text: this is the best saw blade i have used. great for resawing on my 14" porter cable. the paperwork says that 1/2" is the parges that will fit but i was able to use this 3/4" blade without rubbing and it absolutely rips through 6" of very dry cherry like butter. very quiet and super smooth finish. once dialed in there is very little sanding for a perfect face. with my last blade, i lost tons of material as i had to run everything through my planer again just to get a workable face. I'll be buying more Timber Wolf blades in the future
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well
customer_reviews.text: I use this blade for resawing birch and cedar. The 5-7" birch is green and the blade goes right through it. Resawing a 2x6" cedar plank on the 6" dimension is no problem either. Read the enclosed instructions, especially to de-tension the blade when not in use. Response from the company regarding a blade which arrived bent was almost instantaneous - and it turned out to be Amazon-caused damage.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing sharp
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple other blades and they were ok. I thought Id give the Timber Wolf a shot based on the good reviews. I can't believe how fast and clean the blade cuts. Im using it to cut mahogany/ iron wood and it cuts like butter. The other blades would take minutes to cut through a length. The timber wolf is amazing. Very satisfied and will buy nothing else, I dont think there is anything else that could compare.
customer_reviews.author: joseph d garwood

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Just got through cutting a cherry log into boards. Extremely hard wood and the band saw blade wasn't phased a bit by it. Cut straight without wandering. A run through the planer and the boards were good to go. One caution; be careful unwrapping the blade. It is extremely sharp and even with all the precautions I took, it sprung open suddenly and cut my fingers a bit. The blade is much more expensive than other brands. However, I will buy them again because of the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. V

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp but poor weld / good customer serv
customer_reviews.text: Blade cuts awesome but there is about 2 mm back and forth oscillation and a bit of rear track twisting which momentarily touches tracking wheels. Spent over an hour trying to tune. 2/27 Contacted customer service at PS wood machines. They were prompt to send another one. This one cuts well and is smoother. Improving rating from three to four. Not five because it still have some back and forth movement but acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: The Viquars

customer_reviews.title: Hard rock maple in 1/3 the time
customer_reviews.text: Last night I used this blade to cut 9 nightstand legs from 8/4 hard rock maple in slightly less than 30 minutes. My "O----" blade would have taken three times that long, so I'm done with bargain-brand blades. I adjust this "low-tension" blade by monitoring saw vibration; if I can get the vibration minimized so a nickel stands on end without falling over, I know the blade tension is just right, and I'm cutting through hardwoods -- I mean really hard woods -- easily. Timber Wolf makes great blades! I only wish I could justify their carbide-tipped wonders...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Check for straightness as soon as you receive, DON’T WAIT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am sad to say that the QC on these was not up to snuff when I ordered. I haven’t done any resawing until now so I had no need to open the packaging, but now that I have, I find that the blade near the weld point is warped out of line with the rest of the blade and causes a rather dangerous jump motion every time it passes the cutting point. Going to have to give this one up. Update 11-12-2019: I ordered another blade hoping that it was a one off mistake, but the new blade is also not straight. At this point, I'm done with Timber Wolf.
customer_reviews.author: C. Heath

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for cutting green wood logs
customer_reviews.text: I used this blade on my 14 inch Jet bandsaw and it cuts green Hawaiian palm wood great. The instructions included with the blade tell you how to use PAM spray on the blade to cut down on blade friction and sap sticking to the blade- this actually worked. I highly recommend this blade, I also did green wood rip sawing into slabs and it worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: USMC-Guy

customer_reviews.title: Your going to need a welder
customer_reviews.text: Broke at the weld the first time I used it, fortunately we have a great machinist at work, he fixed it... it's been fine since but... if you dont have someone to fix it. Your going to own a very long hacksaw blade.
customer_reviews.author: David Hales

customer_reviews.title: Great blade for resawing.
customer_reviews.text: After years of frustrated attempts at re-saving on my under powered Porter Cable bandsaw, I tried this blade and finally success! There was very little drift from the blade, and with some patience, I was able to resaw a long 6” wide piece of rosewood I had been saving.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth P. Mostello

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blade
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a similar blade that was completely worn out. So, going from 'nothing' to new and sharp is a huge transition. I haven't had this one long enough to have a good idea about durability, but the first few cuts were very nice.
customer_reviews.author: bd_doolin

customer_reviews.title: Good resawing blade
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to resaw oak and black walnut wood for projects. The blade works wonderfully through 6” of oak (the saw’s max opening). The close grain of the walnut proved a bit more difficult, even though the wood is softer, and blade only cuts at half the rate as oak. Overall I am happy with this blade.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yates

customer_reviews.title: My search for a good band saw blade is over
customer_reviews.text: I have bought blades from a number of places and tried a few different brands. I got this blade, (3/4") and was absolutely floored how well it cut. It cut through 4" thick mesquite like butter (a very hard wood), and made it feel as though i was cutting half inch thick plywood. I will be ordering another blade as a back up. I will also comment on how great the blade tracks.. I set the rip fence, and was able to cut straight and true without any effort.
customer_reviews.author: T bone

customer_reviews.title: Bad Weld?
customer_reviews.text: Good sharp blade, but wobbles from front to back. I've checked all my alignments and everything is true and clear. Can't seem to figure out why this is happening but I've read the weld may not always be square and it appears this may have happened on my blade.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B

customer_reviews.title: This is a very effective blade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go through some 130 year old wormy chestnut and have been concerned that my Shop Fox 14" saw would struggle with it. Not. At. All! It went through 6" of this fairly hard lumber like a hot knife through warm butter! Thanks for making the job easy Timber wolf!
customer_reviews.author: KC McMichael

customer_reviews.title: cuts like butter
customer_reviews.text: I was making a filing cabinet and wanted some nice legs. I took two bed posts which were curved and cut them down the middle without a hitch. No blade wander. Perfectly straight cut.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Saltzburg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blade
customer_reviews.text: Although I've only used this blade a dozen times, it performs as advertised. I'm using it to cut joints in 6" treated posts. Once setup according to the instructions, it cuts like butter and does not drift at all. I can't wait to try the 3/16" and 3/8" blades I got at the same time. And I love the idea they don't try and sell you special lubricant, they recommend Pam!
customer_reviews.author: Louis P.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Re-Saw Blade
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this couple weeks ago and it arrived quickly. The Timber Wolf blade work perfectly on my Harbor Freight Bandsaw. I was kind of hesitated at first and also due to the price but it worth every penny. I have no problem re-saw 6" maple and koa and did not have to make any adjustment for blade drift. I will definitely buy more blade from Timber Wolf
customer_reviews.author: Tita Fajotina Ta

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and still sharp
customer_reviews.text: For 5 years, this has been my go to blade for ripping wood including thin hardwood inlays, as thin as 50 mils. Provides very consistent cuts which is critical for thin pieces. Great quality blade, still sharp and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good quality blade
customer_reviews.text: Used this to resaw some 2" walnut with high figure for bookmatched door panels. Worked great, even on my low budget 90's Taiwan made Reliant bandsaw.
customer_reviews.author: jason hine

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I was re sawing some walnut logs with some difficulty so I left the set up and waited for this new blade. The original blade was somewhat new but did not cut smooth enough, noisy, and really slow. With this blade the cut was way better, faster, quiet, and much smoother cut.
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: Fits and cuts wood.
customer_reviews.text: Fits and cuts wood...not sure what's not to like about the blade. Reasonable price and it cuts. So far I've cut about 50 linear feet and it's doing fine. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: JCSailor

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size revommended
customer_reviews.text: Wrong size cited for Jet bandsaw. for JET JWBS-14DXPRO. Too short. Return window closed when I wanted to install blade
customer_reviews.author: Phil A

customer_reviews.title: Timber Wolf Bandsaw Blades-3/4"
customer_reviews.text: I like all of Timber Wolf band-saw blades, but I use the 3/4" for all my "re-saw" work, it tracks very well, requires less tension, produces less heat- all that make my saw work w/ less strain- the method & steel used to produce the hard temper teeth & stiff back rib is a combination that makes "re-sawing" much easier & faster- these blades last 3x's longer than any other I have used in my shop (you can spend big $ for carbide tipped blades) but I don't feel that I have to go further than Timber Wolf- cost efficient, quality, long lasting- that is why I rate it w/ 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Daniel SmithTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Just What I needed
customer_reviews.text: The blade is perfect for re-sawing redwood when I can't get one-by stock. I slice a two-by in half and run it through the planer and voila, perfect one-by stock. Good blade from what I can see.
customer_reviews.author: Robert King

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing blade. I was skeptical at first
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing blade. I was skeptical at first, but after using this I could not believe the difference over the "cheapie" stuff from the local home improvement stores. And even though I foolishly jammed this one (and had to replace it) it did not break! If you need to actually cut things -- especially big thick stuff -- this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Re-sawing upgrade
customer_reviews.text: A definite upgrade from a 1/2" blade, as there's less drift. If you're wanting to resaw logs to dimensional lumber, don't expect this blade to stay sharp very long.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Addleton

customer_reviews.title: For the money, quality is better than expected!!!
customer_reviews.text: about 200 linear feet run through the saw, blade starting to flare already.. nothing beats a wood-slicer blade!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Was Here

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful Thing
customer_reviews.text: I DOUBT You'll be disappointed. One very nicely built blade, I'll buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne-o

customer_reviews.title: Awesome blade
customer_reviews.text: Great! We are cutting exotic hard woods and this blade is amazing
customer_reviews.author: ronda treis

customer_reviews.title: The blade will not last
customer_reviews.text: Lasted three months with little use. Started great but dulled almost overnight! Maple, spruce only. No metals or exotic woods. Band saw setup by myself with high experience. Assume metal failure from quality defects
customer_reviews.author: Dr Carl Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: re-saws really well. I am impressed. Expensive blades like this are worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Resawing Champ
customer_reviews.text: This blade turned my lackluster 1HP 14" import bandsaw into a resawing machine! With my last blade (also a timberwolf but not as well suited) the sad machine was truly struggling to get through 5" white oak. After one cut on an 8' board, the motor was hot enough to cook a steak on. With this 3/4" beast of a blade, she purrs like a kitten, with barely any heat buildup on the same cut. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Zeleske

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: Best blade I've ever used to resaw lumber and reduce waste.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Carder

customer_reviews.title: Yes, yes, and yes!
customer_reviews.text: This blade is awesome! Made short work of my project. Doesn't seem to have dulled at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shag Harris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Re sawing blade
customer_reviews.text: Like the headline says, it's excellent for re-sawing as well as making accurate straight cuts. The surface finish is surprisingly smooth.
customer_reviews.author: James D Charbonneau

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: bought for resawing. Seamed to be perfect for that job.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: The best cut out of any that I have used
customer_reviews.text: What a blade! The only brand I will use from now on. The best cut out of any that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great blade for re-saw applications.
customer_reviews.text: Fair price and rapid shipping. Will require adjustment to blade tension.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben M. Prichard Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Returning my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am returning my purchase due to an acceptable vibrations caused by this weld. There seem to be a micro crack possibly a repair or some bad finishing, however I do like the ease in cutting. I will find another brand, hopefully.
customer_reviews.author: BBA Custom

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR ALL BANDSAWS
customer_reviews.text: i have a grizzly g055x and this is too big for it, not in length but in width
customer_reviews.author: PassionateReviewer

customer_reviews.title: very sharp blade
customer_reviews.text: the blade comes very sharp and cuts through walnut logs with no problem, haven't used it enough to tell how long it will keep cutting as is does new
customer_reviews.author: SNOZ

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, true cutting
customer_reviews.text: This blade really cuts well. Timber Wolf has been the best brand of bandsaw blade I've bought. PS Wood Machines shipped very quickly in good packaging. If the blades I bought ever wear out, I'll get more from PS Wood Machines!
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: Quality blade
customer_reviews.text: I think you can trust Timber Wolf blades. Quality cuts I think with proper care should last awhile
customer_reviews.author: chipper

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Used it to re-saw old fence boards it worked perfectly , very sharp a little pricey though overall very satisfied. I’ll be Shopping for more blades in the future with you .Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for resawing
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time we tried a 3/4" blade for resawing and what a difference. it was much stronger and did an excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Great blades, worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: These blades are awesome. I thought something was wrong with my saw and I adjusted, adjusted, adjusted. It was my blades all along.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best bandsaw on the market today
customer_reviews.text: One of the best bandsaw on the market today. I used it on my new bandsaw and it is just what I needed for resawing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure there's better blades out there
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but the weld does cause it to run a bit rough. Was able to do what I needed it to do. I'm sure there's better blades out there, but for the price it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic re-saw blade.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing re-saw blade. Also, it is the only blade that will track square and true (for me) producing an excellent veneer. You MUST take the time to properly adjust your saw according to instructions in package.
customer_reviews.author: G. Dean

customer_reviews.title: but it's not meant to be pretty, does the job on my Grizzly bandsaw
customer_reviews.text: A little rough and noisy, but it's not meant to be pretty, does the job on my Grizzly bandsaw.
customer_reviews.author: T. McThrifty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, Blade seems to be exceptional quality. Cuts clean and straight.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Great for resawing hardwoods
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blade. It is very sharp and made resawing Eastern Maple super easy. I 100% recommend this blade for resawing hardwoods!
customer_reviews.author: Derek McComb

customer_reviews.title: Totally Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I cut 6x6 pressure treated SYP and 4x4 Cumaru with no effort at all. An absolute delight.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Mayotte

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, clean cutter.
customer_reviews.text: Such a sharp, clean cutting blade. I needed for a re-sawing application and it performed flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Artis

customer_reviews.title: Re-saw blade.
customer_reviews.text: A very good blade for re-sawing on a 14 inch bandsaw. Be sure to read the directions carefully.
customer_reviews.author: George Hayner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Timber Wolf makes great bandsaw blades. These things cut and cut and cut.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: excellent blade
customer_reviews.text: cleanly, and quickly cut through a variety of hardwood logs. Best bandsaw resaw blade I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: M. Koslosky

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: Timberwolf, the name says it all! Best of the best!!
customer_reviews.author: Norm Burt

customer_reviews.title: Great blade
customer_reviews.text: This blade is awesome. Just used it for a bunch of resawing and it went through everything like butter. I'm definitely only buying timberwolf from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blade
customer_reviews.text: One of the best blades for resawing I've used at 3/4 inch. Normally, you really get what you pay for in blades, but this one is reasonably priced and hasn't started dulling on me after dozens of board feet.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t stay sharp
customer_reviews.text: Did few hours of re-sawing in birch and blade did not hold its edge or sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: E. Klos

customer_reviews.title: resawing blade
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well once the blade was installed and the guides adjusted
customer_reviews.author: Fred Clanton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality blade
customer_reviews.text: Excellent blade- cuts true - been resawing black walnut- cool cutting blade
customer_reviews.author: Joeriv

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and effective for resawing.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Already did several resaws and it works perfectly. No trouble mounting it to bandsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Hoefts

customer_reviews.title: ... blade on my grizzly 14 inch bandsaw and it easy re-saws hard wood stright and with little effort
customer_reviews.text: Put this blade on my grizzly 14 inch bandsaw and it easy re-saws hard wood stright and with little effort. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Burt Maclin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have used it minimally so far but will be putting through the ringer soon.
customer_reviews.author: jcradar77

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Clean, straight, fast cuts. I liked that they included a quick guide to tensioning, as that had seemed a bit of a 'black art' in my research.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Works great Read the paper that comes with it both front and back
customer_reviews.author: justneed to know

customer_reviews.title: ... instructions the put with the blades are straight-forward and useful.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions the put with the blades are straight-forward and useful.
customer_reviews.author: d.w

customer_reviews.title: purchased as a gift
customer_reviews.text: This was given as a gift and my son-in-law liked it.
customer_reviews.author: noreen c.

customer_reviews.title: smooth and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Cuts smooth and quiet, very nice. Tensioning instruction needs work
customer_reviews.author: MAXX

customer_reviews.title: I read the reviews and this works as expected. ...
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and this works as expected. Using a 1 hp Jet 14" bandsaw I was able to resaw 6" diameter cherry logs. Saw cut thru the wood with little effort. Very impressed with this blade.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bandsaw blade. Quality is apparent with the first cut. I would recommend this blade to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only re-sawed about 30’ of 2x6 redwood and it cuts great.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Huber

customer_reviews.title: Too much blade
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars because Timber Wolf bandsaw blades are the best. However, I think this may just be too much blade for a 14 inch bandsaw. If you don't have a riser block you are not re sawing more than 5.5 inches and a 1/2 inch blade should be more than adequate. If you are using riser blocks, I don't think a 14 inch saw has the structural strength to tension or the power to run this blade through anything substantial. It just smoked my delta. I will try replacing my drive belt and getting more tension on the blade because I see others have had good results, but that's my experience thus far.
customer_reviews.author: B. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was suprised at how well it holds in re saw
customer_reviews.author: Irvin McFall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Using my Grizzly 555, this blade works flawlessly re-sawing hardwoods (so far Red Oak and Walnut).
customer_reviews.author: Ken Owen

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely a fine blade. I use it for re-sawing 2x6's into ...
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely a fine blade. I use it for re-sawing 2x6's into thin veneers. Cuts clean with minimum saw marks.
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: rocks!
customer_reviews.text: love these blades. good price, super high quality. i have been using the 3/4"ers for resawing Elm logs with great success.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lipscomb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts nice and straight, good for re-sawing. Have not tried on hardwoods.
customer_reviews.author: Moose252

customer_reviews.title: Bandsaw Blade that is great for resawing
customer_reviews.text: I used this blade to resaw some hickory. It cuts through it like better. Does a great job with a very clean cut.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific results from this blade
customer_reviews.text: I love this 3/4" blade for resawing - so smooth. Unfortunately, it's too much blade for my Delta 14". It's usable, but I risk turning the machine into a pretzel -- the tension pulls my wheels (too far) out of alignment and when under tension, the teeth of the blade are just a metric (ahem) eye lash from the edge of the wheel. I switched over to the 1/2" version of the blade. Still nice, 5 star nice, but not as nice as the 3/4" version. If you've got a beefy bandsaw, yeah buddy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: My first attempt at re-sawing - wow!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted and tensioned the blade without issue, set up a fence (nothing fancy, piece of wood clamped to table) to produce an 1/8 inch ply for my first attempt at bent lamination. Ran my board through and was amazed at how easily it fed and how straight the cut was! Just ordered a 1/4 inch and a 3/8 inch blade to replace my old stock blade!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos & Maria Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: great blade
customer_reviews.text: I had a project where we needed to cut 450 curved 2x stock for a shingle flair, blade performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Good Blade
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this blade 5 stars if I had been using it more and knew how well it would last. I used it to resaw Yellow heart, thought I was cutting butter.
customer_reviews.author: Handy

customer_reviews.title: Cut better and hold a better edge
customer_reviews.text: This beats the Olson All Pro blades I have been using for years. Cut better and hold a better edge. Set up your blade according to included directions for best results.
customer_reviews.author: conservative dad

customer_reviews.title: the other one I ordered from a different company fits fine.
customer_reviews.text: Simply not the right size.... it's not 93 and 1/2...does NOT fit. Very odd that the sizing would be so far off. Beware. And yes...I have ordered a dozen blades and changed them out before.... lol...the other one I ordered from a different company fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey Hamrick

customer_reviews.title: 3/4 blade
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to dull a little faster than I expected but would order again
customer_reviews.author: BobT

customer_reviews.title: Far and away better than the blades you can buy at typical blades ...
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it much, hence my slightly reduced rating. Far and away better than the blades you can buy at typical blades seen at the local big box and even some of the specialty stores. Sharp, stable, and comes with detailed and useful instructions about how to use it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Hintz

customer_reviews.title: blade
customer_reviews.text: Resaws 8 inch wood with no problems at all. Nice thin kerf, so no wood is wasted. I especially like the idea that it uses low tension. A marvelous, marvelous blade from a good company.
customer_reviews.author: scottt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Take extreme care removing from the package as the blades are very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: These blades are awesome. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: These blades are awesome. Highly recommend.i have been cutting 3 inch black walnut with a 14 inch ridged band saw and they do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: dennis roberson

customer_reviews.title: average
customer_reviews.text: Resawed ~120 lineal feet of 6" birch before the blade got too dull to go on. It's not bad, but I did expect a little more life out of it. It did track nicely and tooth marks were very easy to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Josko A. Catipovic

customer_reviews.title: Average Performance
customer_reviews.text: Resawed 280 feet of 3-3/4" red cedar before the blade became too dull to feed without excessive force.
customer_reviews.author: Ptah

customer_reviews.title: Cuts nice but the back and forth travel of the blade ...
customer_reviews.text: Cuts nice but the back and forth travel of the blade is the most i've seen in a blade

customer_reviews.author: Emartin

product_meta.title: Timber Wolf Bandsaw Blade 3/4" x 93-1/2", 3 TPI
product_meta.description: Timber Wolf makes the world's only thin-kerf, low tension, silicon steel bandsaw blades that will outlast your old carbon steel blades by a mile! Your bandsaw will cut better and faster, with less wear on bearings, shafts and tires. Tooth angles and gullet symmetries, combined with a unique set pattern, create a blade that is everything a wood-cutting blade was meant to be. Blade has over 60% of the speed capabilities of a hook blade while giving you the great finish of a skip. The round design of the gullet eliminates any work hardening zones. Couple that with the special 6.5° rake, 5-tooth set pattern, and .025" thick thin-kerf blade and you have an awesome bandsaw blade!
feature_bullets: Runs under low tension which requires less horsepower
